toneDeaf.highComment: You are very tone deaf.  Consider <this technique to address it>
toneDeaf.lowComment: Sounds like you've got good pitch

monoTone.highComment: You're signing the same song, and it's getting tiresome.  Try <insert technique here>
monoTone.lowComment: You've been responding to your team's needs, and that's super.

risingStar.highComment: You're a rising star: But to avoid becoming overburdened, use <insert technique>
risingStar.lowComment: Either you already are a rising star, or you've yet to become one.  Do you have your own wikipedia page yet?

greatnessInSight.highComment: You have greatness in sight: To avoid distractions, use <insert technique>
greatnessInSight.lowComment: If you can <insert technique here>, you'll have greatness in sight

rockStar.highComment: Congratulations, you're a rock star!  Use <this set of tools> to keep developing yourself and your team
rockStar.lowComment: You're not yet a rock star, but we can turn you into one.  Use <insert technique> or <insert technique>

questions.text: Are your customers raving fans?
Do people know how they win?
Do you hit deadlines 90% of the time?
Do people know what they are uniquely on the hook for?
Do they know what everybody else is uniquely on the hook for?
Is there anyone on the team that causes a lot of drama?
Can you think of someone on your team who is regularly overwhelmed?
In the past three months, have you taken any work off your team's plate?
Can everyone recite what business you are in? (the same way)
Can everyone define who your ideal customer is?
Do you have the same complaints and conversations over and over?
Does everyone know and follow the on-boarding process?
Do people throw eachother under the bus regularly?
Do you give regular feedback?
Do you do quarterly reviews?
Do people have action items at the end of a meeting?
Does your team get stuff done as expected?
Do you have to tell people what to do?
Do you witness more than 2 blow-ups a week?
How happy are you with your team's productivity?
Do you work over 50 hours a week?
Have you lost staff in the last three months?
